Donate

Animal Abusers Convicted

OUR VISION AND MISSION

Animal Equality’s vision is a world in which all animals are respected and protected.

Animal Equality is an international organisation working with society, governments and companies to end cruelty to farmed animals.

OUR VALUES

As an animal protection organisation, we are guided by compassion, determination and effectiveness.

Using these values to launch innovative projects and strategic campaigns, we work to expose and abolish the cruel practices of the animal agriculture industry.

Photo: Colombo Nicola / Shutterstock.com

OUR WORK

Our teams in the UK, Germany, Italy, Spain, Mexico, Brazil, USA and India consist of highly qualified professionals with years of experience in undercover investigations, corporate campaigns, political outreach and the development of large-scale education programmes.

OUR COMMITMENT

With over ten years of experience in international campaigns, we are committed to saving as many animals as possible and to reducing the enormous suffering animals endure on factory farms. Our commitment to continually assessing the impact of our campaigns and programmes makes us increasingly efficient at saving lives.

Left photo: Animal Equality
Right photo: Miriam Doerr Martin Frommherz / Shutterstock.com

Our work

Animal Equality works strategically in four distinct areas to ensure progress for animals.

Investigations

Education

Corporate Outreach

Legal Advocacy

Animal Equality by the Numbers

8

country offices

700

facilities investigated

4.4 MILLION

followers on
social media

930 MILLION

reach on Facebook

2,679

Media stories generated last year

ANIMAL EQUALITY:
TOP CHARITY 2018

Animal Charity Evaluators (ACE) is an independent organisation that evaluates various animal protection groups in the US and Europe each year to assess their effectiveness and efficacy for animals. Every year since 2014, Animal Equality has been recognised as one of the most efficient animal protection organisations in the world.

In its analysis from the year 2018, ACE found that Animal Equality effectively uses our limited resources to help save millions of animals from a cruel fate and named Animal Equality a Top Charity.

Photo: Tuzemka / Shutterstock.com

Read the Full Report

WHAT OTHERS SAY

There’s so much work for me to do. There’s so much work for you to do, but we’re winning and we’re going to win a lot sooner than we think we are.

Moby

Musician

International Achievements

We want to share some of our international achievements with you. Without your support none of this would be possible, thanks for being on the side of the animals!

UK Dairy reforms

We saw two victories in 2017. Our investigation in 2016, which uncovered shocking cruelty towards cows and calves at the family-run Pyrlands Dairy Farm, led to the conviction of the farm worker responsible. Furthermore, Marks and Spencer audited Grange Dairy and subsequently joined the RSPCA Assured Scheme after our investigation showed six-month-old calves were being caged in solitary pens meant for calves up to the age of six-weeks. Although dairy farming can never be humane, this step eliminates some of the worst cruelty.

Helping End Rabbit Cages

Maximum Penalty for Animal Cruelty

Ending Cages for Hens
